FuncDef:
The ignore-mtu-match command configures a PE not to perform the MTU match check for an MPLS L2VPN instance.
The undo ignore-mtu-match command restores the default configuration.
By default, a PE performs the MTU match check for an MPLS L2VPN instance.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, a PE performs the MTU match check for an MPLS L2VPN instance. If the MTUs of the same L2VPN instance on the two endpoint PEs do not match, the VC cannot go Up. In a BGP VPWS scenario, if a Huawei device interworks with a non-Huawei device that does not support the MTU match check, run the ignore-mtu-match command to configure the Huawei device not to perform the MTU match check.
Prerequisites
No VPN targets have been configured for the MPLS L2VPN instance.
